channel.title: Well this is bugging me
channel.description:
Well lately my computer has been running incredibly slow, so I decided to check my CPU usage. It was up to 100%, and I couldn't find any processes causing it. So I then went into Resource Manager and found this: [img]http://img829.imageshack.us/img829/8250/81391663.png[/img]
I suspended the process svchost.exe(LocalServiceAndNoImpersonation) as it was using all of my free CPU, which was significantly lowering my speed. I'm not sure how important this process is so I haven't ended it, but why would it take up so much CPU?

[/quote]

HE IS ASKING WHY.[/quote]

And why send me a message I am fucking retarted?

item.title: Well this is bugging me
item.dc:creator: @im_hard im hard
item.description:
@im_hard wrote:

howtogeek.com

What Is the Service Host Process (svchost.exe) and Why Are So Many Running?

If you’ve ever browsed through Task Manager, you may have wondered why there are so many Service Host processes running. You can’t kill them, and you sure didn’t start them. So, what are they?

I suppose your banned from google?

Read full topic

item.title: Well this is bugging me
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Use google, I do when I find processes that I have no clue what they do. I even use it to find services I don’t need that I can shut off to lower my CPU and bandwidth.

item.title: Well this is bugging me
item.dc:creator: @rip4d rip4d
item.description:
@rip4d wrote:

[quote=“Kihomura, post:4, topic:349925”]Would you happen to have an antivirus with real time scanning (like nod32) because I have nod32 and it used to scan almost all the time and bring up my CPU usage to 100% and it would stay at that for a long time.[/quote]Nope. I use Norton Security Suite and it only does Idle Scans once in a while, and its usually when I’m not on the computer, so it is out of the question for the high CPU usage.

As long as the process is suspended my computer is fine, but I just don’t get why its doing this.

Read full topic

item.title: Well this is bugging me
item.dc:creator: @kihomura Kihomura
item.description:
@kihomura wrote:

Would you happen to have an antivirus with real time scanning (like nod32) because I have nod32 and it used to scan almost all the time and bring up my CPU usage to 100% and it would stay at that for a long time.

Read full topic

item.title: Well this is bugging me
item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

Unless it is the regular svchost for windows, it could be a problem. I had a problem with that, but it turned out to be a virus that escaped to look as if it was within windows. I would check on that ones location, and make sure thats not the regular svchost within windows.

Read full topic

Well lately my computer has been running incredibly slow, so I decided to check my CPU usage. It was up to 100%, and I couldn’t find any processes causing it. So I then went into Resource Manager and found this:

I suspended the process svchost.exe(LocalServiceAndNoImpersonation) as it was using all of my free CPU, which was significantly lowering my speed. I’m not sure how important this process is so I haven’t ended it, but why would it take up so much CPU?
